info.name: Spinal cord, dorsal horn
info.description: The dorsal horn of the spinal cord is AKA the posterior horn of the spinal cord. It is that portion of spinal cord gray matter dorsal to the central canal that generally deals with sensory information. Since it is a derivative of the alar plate, it deals with sensory functions.
info.item: /Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/1 Sacral cord, middle
/Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/2 Lumbar cord, middle
/Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/3 Lumbar cord, upper
/Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/4 Thoracic cord
/Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/5 Cervical cord, lower
/Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/6 Cervical cord, middle
/Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/7 Cervical cord, upper
/Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/8 Cervical cord, C1
/Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/9 Cord-Medulla Junction
/Gross/Spinal Cord/8 Cervical cord - upper cross section
/Gross/Spinal Cord/9 Cervical cord - lower cross section
